repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second Emergency
            Education Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Emergency
            Education Reconstruction Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina
            are to improve primary education access and quality by
            reconstructing primary schools throughout Bosnia and
            Herzegovina. The project's overall outcome is rated
            satisfactory. Key lessons learned from this project are: 1)
            Rapid reconstruction has medium term cost in terms of
            delayed policy and institutional reform. 2) Better
            communication and coordination among donors and different
            levels of government is essential within the Federation and
            between entities. 3) Reconstruction in many areas cannot
            proceed effectively without progress in addressing key
            policy issues in the sector. 4) It will take time before
            parties to the conflict accept the role education must play
            in promoting reconciliation.

748692.trustfund:
TF021083-ITALY - BHZ-EDUCATION
            RECONSTRUCTION PROJECT II,TF020873-RECONSTRUCTION PROGRAM
            PREPARATION (BANK EX.)

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Second Emergency
            Education Reconstruction Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objective of the Second
            Emergency Education Reconstruction Project for Bosnia and
            Herzegovina (the Federation) is to continue the work begun
            under the first project similarly named, which aimed to
            restore adequate teaching and learning conditions in the
            country's primary schools. Secondary objectives are to
            help develop an appropriate process of education finance and
            administration, to build government implementation capacity
            to plan and deliver education programs at different
            government levels, and to facilitate communication and
            cooperation on education issues within the Federation, and
            between the Federation and the Serb Republic. The project
            will support: 1) reconstruction of primary schools in the
            Federation and of about seven primary schools in the Serb
            Republic; 2) provision of classroom furniture and equipment;
            3) provision of textbooks and educational materials for
            Federation schools; 4) support for incremental recurrent
            costs for the two project implementation units; and 5)
            technical assistance to improve education finance and administration.
